sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &applet; applet enables you to create, view, and manage sticky notes on your desktop. You can edit the title, contents, dimensions, and style of sticky notes. When the applet is restarted, for example when you log out and log in again, all sticky notes are saved and reopened in the same position with the same dimensions and style.
To add &applet; to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose Add to Panel. Select &applet; in the Add to the panel dialog, then click OK.

sect2.title: Creating a Sticky Note
sect2.para: You can create a sticky note in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose New Note from the applet right-click menu.
Right-click on the title of an existing note, then choose New Note from the popup menu.
Depending on your preference settings, you may be able to create a new sticky note simply by clicking on the &applet; applet. For information on this setting, see .

sect2.title: Locking and Unlocking Sticky Notes
sect2.para: You can lock or unlock all sticky notes at the same time, or you can lock or unlock individual sticky notes. Locking a sticky note prevents you from accidentally changing the contents of the note.

term.phrase: To Lock or Unlock All Sticky Notes

listitem.para: To lock all sticky notes so that the notes cannot be edited, choose Lock Notes from the applet right-click menu so that there is a check mark next to it. To unlock all sticky notes, choose Lock Notes from the applet right-click menu again so that there is not a check mark next to it.
Note that all applets have the Lock item in the right-click menu, which locks the position of the applet on the panel. Do not confuse this with the Lock Notes item.
Depending on your preference settings, you may be able to lock and unlock all sticky notes simply by clicking on the &applet; applet. For information on this setting, see .

term.phrase: To Lock or Unlock Individual Sticky Notes

listitem.para: To lock an individual sticky note, right-click on the title of the note, then choose Lock Note from the popup menu. To unlock an individual note, right-click on the title of the note, then choose Lock Note from the popup menu again.

sect2.title: Deleting Sticky Notes
sect2.para: You can delete all sticky notes at the same time, or you can delete individual sticky notes.

listitem.para: To delete all sticky notes, choose Delete Notes from the applet right-click menu. A confirmation dialog will appear; click on the Delete ALL button to confirm the deletion.
To delete an individual sticky note, right-click on the title of the note, then choose Delete Note from the popup menu.

sect2.title: Hiding and Showing Sticky Notes
sect2.para: You can hide all sticky notes so that they do not appear on your desktop. Sticky notes are not deleted when they are hidden. To hide all sticky notes, choose Show Notes from the applet right-click menu so that there is not a check mark next to it. To show all sticky notes, choose Show Notes from the applet right-click menu again so there is a check mark next to it.
Depending on your preference settings, you may be able hide and show all sticky notes simply by clicking on the &applet; applet. For information on this setting, see .

sect2.title: Adjusting Size
sect2.para: To configure the default size for all sticky notes, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences from the popup menu. The Sticky Notes Preferences dialog is displayed.

listitem.para: Use this spin box to specify the default width of new sticky notes, in pixels.
Use this spin box to specify the default height of new sticky notes, in pixels.

sect2.title: Changing Color and Font
sect2.para: To configure the color and font for all sticky notes, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences from the popup menu. The Sticky Notes Preferences dialog is displayed.

listitem.para: Click on the color selector button to display the color selector dialog. On the color selector dialog, use the color wheel or spin boxes to choose the default base color for sticky notes.
Select Use color from the system theme to use the current system theme to determine the default base color of uncustomized sticky notes.
Click on the font selector button to display the font selector dialog. On the font selector dialog, use the list boxes to choose the default font for sticky notes.
Select Use font from the system theme to use the current system theme to determine the default font of uncustomized sticky notes.
Under Behavior, select Force default color and font on notes to specify that all sticky notes, including customized notes, must use the default style.

sect2.title: Customizing Behavior
sect2.para: To customize the behavior of &applet;, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences from the popup menu. The Sticky Notes Preferences dialog is displayed.

To specify that sticky notes are visible on all workspaces on the desktop, select Put notes on all workspaces in the Sticky Notes Preferences dialog. If you are using multiple workspaces, this will cause all sticky notes to be visible on all workspaces.
To specify what happens when you click on the &applet; applet, choose the appropriate item in the list labeled Click.

listitem.para: If you select this option, a new sticky note will be created each time you click on the &applet; applet. For information on creating new sticky notes, see .
If you select this option, clicking on the &applet; applet will toggle whether all the sticky notes are hidden or shown. For information on hiding and showing sticky notes, see .
If you select this option, clicking on the &applet; applet will toggle whether all the sticky notes are locked or unlocked. For information on locking sticky notes, see .

sect2.title: Customizing Individual Notes
sect2.para: You can customize the look of each individual sticky note. This can be useful for visually distinguishing different types of notes quickly. To configure the settings for an individual sticky note, right-click on the note's title, then choose Properties from the popup menu. The Sticky Note Properties dialog is displayed.

listitem.para: Use this text box to specify the title of the sticky note.
Click on the color selector button to display the color selector dialog. On the color selector dialog, use the color wheel or spin boxes to choose the base color for this sticky note.
Select this option to use the default base color for this sticky note. For information on setting the default base color, see .
Click on the font selector button to display the font selector dialog. On the font selector dialog, use the list boxes to choose the font for this sticky note.
Select this option to use the default font for this sticky note. For information on setting the default font, see .
